definition: gift given to sb when meeting them for the first time
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: What gift would you like to give them at your first meeting?
sentences.chinese: 你想送什麼見面禮給它們呢？

sentences.english: You just took the "gift" and came back?
sentences.chinese: 然後你拿了“見面禮”就回來了？

sentences.english: This is that I give your encounter a gift.
Why didn't you share in my welcome gift?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼他們都有見面禮，就你沒有呢？

sentences.english: I heard that you are fond of collecting NVIDIA products, and this is greeting gift.
sentences.chinese: 聽說你喜歡收集NVIDIA的東西，這個是見面禮。

sentences.english: Now, we have realized that Elsevier's gentleness is only one time discount for the first time meet.
sentences.chinese: 現在看來，這些只是一份見面禮，一塊敲門磚。

definition: to return a greeting/to send a gift in return
to accept a gift/to receive presents
overwhelmed by favor from superior (humble expr.)
angry words/sth said in the moment of anger
